On Tue, 8 May 2001, Lucas Filz wrote:

[snip]
>  javax.naming.NoInitialContextException
[snip]
> So, my tests run fine with -noloading, but excluding like this in a
> junit/util/excluded.properties:
[snip]
> leads to the old problem (same as not using the -noloading).
> (Classes under test are in com.update.redrock.ecm.campaign)
> 
> I put the file in K:\redrock\dev\classes\junit\util\excluded.properties.
> 
> JBuilder tells me that K:\redrock\dev\classes is on the classpath:
> 
> J:\ide\JBuilder4\jdk1.3\bin\javaw -classic -classpath
> "K:\redrock\dev\classes;
> 
> 
> What else could be wrong?

I think -noloading affects everything the unit tests load while they
execute since it disabled the JUnit loader altogether.

I haven't used javax.naming.  Are you sure the problem isn't in another
class, perhaps something down in javax.naming?  What is the full text
of the exception stack trace you're getting?

Are you sure the classpath under which the tests run places your redrock
classpath before the junit jar?  If not, your custom properties file
won't be found before the one bundled into junit.
--
